maintenance.translation[0].definitions[0: the repairs, painting etc that are necessary to keep something in good condition
maintenance crew/man/staff (=someone who looks after buildings and equipment for a school or organization)
the cost of repairs and maintenance
The theatres were closed on Saturday and Sunday for routine maintenance.
Engineers are carrying out essential maintenance work on the main line to Cambridge.
an evening class in car maintenance
The caretaker is responsible for the maintenance of the school buildings.
maintenance.translation[0].definitions[1: the act of making a state or situation continue
The purpose of the UN is the maintenance of international peace and security.
The maintenance of a firm currency plays an important part in the battle against inflation.
maintenance.translation[0].definitions[2: money paid by someone who is divorced to their former wife or husband
They have to find the fathers who abandon their children and make them pay maintenance.
maintenance.translation[1].definitions[0: the repairs, painting etc necessary to keep something in good condition or working as it should
The line will be re-opened once essential maintenance is completed.
Technicians were doing routine maintenance work on the aircraft.
maintenance.translation[1].definitions[1: when something is continued in the same way or at the same level as before
The maintenance of economic growth is very important.
maintenance.translation[1].definitions[2: money paid by a DIVORCED person (=someone who has legally ended their marriage) to their former wife or husband, especially towards the cost of looking after their children
He has to pay Â£500 per week maintenance to his ex-wife.
